data.name: t
data.doc: The set type, implemented as a map from elements to boolean values indicating membership

data.name: empty
data.doc: Creates an empty set where all elements are mapped to false
data.pattern: Initializing a new set before adding elements, similar to creating an empty HashSet or Set in other languages

data.name: full
data.doc: Creates a full set where all elements are mapped to true
data.pattern: Creating a universal set containing all possible elements, often used as a starting point for set operations like complement

data.name: is_empty
data.doc: Tests if set [s] is empty by comparing it to the empty set
data.pattern: Checking if a collection contains any elements before performing operations, like validating user input or checking search results

data.name: is_valid
data.doc: Checks if set [s] is valid. Always returns true since all sets are valid
data.pattern: Validating set integrity, though in this implementation all sets are considered valid by design

data.name: mem
data.doc: Tests if element [x] is a member of set [s]
data.pattern: Testing element existence in a collection, like checking if a user ID exists or if a value is allowed

data.name: subset
data.doc: Tests if set [s1] is a subset of set [s2]
data.pattern: Checking if one collection's elements are fully contained within another, like validating permissions or category hierarchies

data.name: add
data.pattern: Adding unique elements to a collection, ensuring no duplicates, like building a set of unique identifiers or tags

data.name: remove
data.pattern: Removing elements from a collection while maintaining uniqueness, like removing revoked permissions or deleted items

data.name: inter
data.doc: Computes the intersection of sets [s1] and [s2]
data.pattern: Finding common elements between two collections, like identifying shared permissions or matching criteria

data.name: union
data.doc: Computes the union of sets [s1] and [s2]
data.pattern: Combining two collections while eliminating duplicates, like merging user groups or combining search results

data.name: complement
data.pattern: Finding all elements not in a set, useful for implementing negation or finding excluded items

data.name: diff
data.doc: Computes the difference of sets [s1] and [s2]
data.pattern: Finding elements in one collection but not another, like identifying unique permissions or filtering exclusions

data.name: of_list
data.doc: Creates a set from list [l] by recursively adding each element
data.pattern: Converting sequences or arrays to sets while eliminating duplicates, like creating a set of unique values from user input or data import
Providing a more concise syntax for combining sets, similar to overloaded operators in other languages
Providing a more concise syntax for set difference, similar to overloaded operators in other languages

program_prelude: val subset_ : ('a, bool) Map.t -> 'a t -> bool
val add_ : 'a -> ('a, bool) Map.t -> ('a, bool) Map.t
val remove_ : 'a -> ('a, bool) Map.t -> ('a, bool) Map.t
val pp : (Stdlib.Format.formatter -> 'a -> unit) -> Stdlib.Format.formatter -> 'a t -> unit
